intro: Quercus yiwuensis, commonly known as the Yiwu oak, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn and its production of acorns. It typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
